image.altText: portrait shot of Kerry Wynn-Taylor in her loungeroom

props.synopsis: A 'ticking time bomb' was unleashed inside this retired school teacher's body when she was exposed to asbestos. Now she's joining the fight to make the removal of the deadly material safe and affordable to all.

title.children: 'It's insidious': Retired WA teacher with mesothelioma joins push to dispose of millions of tonnes of asbestos

image.altText: a row of small dongas line the side of a footpath with small air conditioning units outside and a sunset in the distance

props.synopsis: Plans for improved tourism accommodation in the Pilbara have been unsuccessful, and the local mayor is up in arms over federal ministers being forced to stay in a workers' camp.

title.children: This affluent WA mining city wants a Hilton Hotel, but what it's getting looks like a workers' camp

image.altText: John Della Franca

props.synopsis: A man who admitted fatally shooting a father of three in WA's south west is sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: Farmer jailed for life for murdering man he wrongly accused of stealing avocados

image.altText: Graphic image of a boy, a letter and barbed wire

props.synopsis: Weeks before he took his own life behind bars, the 17-year-old boy at the centre of the latest tragedy engulfing WA's Department of Justice said he wanted to turn his life around. But he didn't live to see his next birthday.

title.children: Ben wrote he didn't want to go to an adult jail. He never made it to 18

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: While Democrats hope Donald Trump debate rhetoric will turn off undecided voters, the former president is doubling down, even flooding his social media accounts with "Cats for Trump" memes.

title.children: Trump faced a backlash for claiming pets were being eaten in Ohio. This is why he's not backing down

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short grey hair, dressed in a dark suit, stands amid journalists outside a court.

props.synopsis: The court of Criminal Appeal has told the ABC the bus driver has lodged a notice of intention to appeal the 32-year jail term he received over the crash that killed 10 people.

title.children: Brett Button begins appeal process after being jailed over Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: The brain of a teen girl

props.synopsis: Mental health disorders among young people have risen nearly 50 per cent in the past 15 years. We go inside a teen brain to show how modern pressures impact the adolescent mind and where it can go wrong.

title.children: How trauma and pressure manifest inside a teenager’s brain

image.altText: Two boys hold fishing rods and smile at the camera next to a lake.

props.synopsis: Patricia Smith faced Parramatta Local Court this morning, after being charged last night with two counts of domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: Mother denied bail after appearing in court for first time over alleged murder of two sons

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at a lectern with Anika Wells and Jim Chalmers beside him.

props.synopsis: For those with long political memories, there has been a bit of deja vu all over again in federal politics this week.

title.children: Buried in this week's aged care reforms was an idea that once cost two ministers their jobs

image.altText: A map covering his face stands in a tiny room with plates on the floor and blankets hanging on the wall

props.synopsis: The Rohingya ethnic minority are being forcibly conscripted by Myanmar's military and rebel groups to fight in the civil war.

title.children: Kidnapped by rebels and forced into someone else's war, the Rohingya face a new nightmare

image.altText: Alec MacDonald of the Storm tackles Cameron McInnes of the Sharks

props.synopsis: Cronulla is looking to repeat its heroics from earlier this season and defeat the Storm in Melbourne, with a preliminary home final on the line for the winner. Follow live.

title.children: Storm and Sharks meet in Melbourne for the right to host a preliminary final

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Team lists in for Melbourne Storm and Cronulla Sharks
Welcome to the ABC Sport live blog of the NRL finals

image.altText: Four burritos cut open with various ingredients. In the centre is a blue rectangle with the words "AI-GENERATED?" in white text

props.synopsis: Artificially generated images, video and audio have flooded the internet in recent years. Take our quiz to see if you can tell real from fake.

title.children: Can you spot AI like a verification journalist? Take our quiz

image.altText: A street sign that says Matsumoto street with red dirt in the background and a blue sky

props.synopsis: Petrol is $2, coffee is $6.50 and the average rental is $750 a week, yet this town is home to some of the most impoverished communities in Western Australia. What's gone wrong?

title.children: Gentrification means this family can't afford to buy a house on a street that's named after them

image.altText: A rainbow flag

props.synopsis: The Western Australian government says it "won't have time" to pass a ban on gay conversion therapy before next year's state election, despite a promise made two years ago.

title.children: Western Australia pushes back plan to ban gay conversion therapy

image.altText: Couple in 1980s wedding attire signs registry

props.synopsis: Kelly Delaney only learnt the full extent of her husband's lies and deceit after his body was found in Victorian bushland.

title.children: Mum bares all about life married to a compulsive gambler

image.altText: excavator demolishing old house.

props.synopsis: The New South Wales Reconstruction Authority has apologised for demolishing the house before its owner could decide what to do with it.

title.children: 'Such a waste': Historic Lismore home demolished after flood buyback without owner's knowledge

image.altText: A young white school boy holding a book, sitting next to a middle aged white woman smiling

props.synopsis: The ABC has been given rare access to two of the country's little-known free private schools that exist to serve disadvantaged students.

title.children: This school provides free meals and 50-week terms to stop students missing out on an education

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in a ponytail sitting outside a motel room

props.synopsis: Jessica Davies's family is one of many living in a motel while waiting for permanent accommodation. She says the arrangement is "not suitable" — but it's better than living in a tent.

title.children: 'Takes a very big toll': Housing crisis forces mum of four to live out of motel room

image.altText: snow speckled mountain can be seen behind buildings at elizabeth pier in hobart tasmania

props.synopsis: Spring's infamous variability will be on full display this weekend, delivering a blast of cold Antarctic air and potentially the coldest September weather in decades.

title.children: Antarctic air mass to deliver weekend snow, hail and thunder to eastern Australia

image.altText: Three young men, one Black and two white, sit on chairs in blue and yellow shirts speaking to each other

props.synopsis: Citizens of the US, UK, Belgium and France have been convicted of participating in a coup attempt against the Congolese government in May this year.

title.children: Six foreigners sentenced to death in Democratic Republic of Congo

image.altText: Ken Hinkley and James Sicily exchanged words after the siren

props.synopsis: Hawthorn captain James Sicily defends his behaviour following a heated exchange with Port Adelaide coach Ken Hinkley in the wake of Friday night's AFL semifinal.

title.children: 'I don't regret it': Sicily stands firm after Hinkley confrontation as AFL issues 'please explain' to Power coach

image.altText: Three firefighters with hoses trying to put out an underground fire

props.synopsis: A fire that began in suspicious circumstances is still burning underground south of Bunbury, despite the best efforts of firefighters and one of the wettest winters on record.

title.children: One of WA's longest-burning fires is still smouldering after a million litres of water

image.altText: An overhead shot of two swags set up on a white sandy beach with crystal clear blue waters behind

props.synopsis: Most tourists visit well-known Great Keppel Island, but smaller national park islands like its neighbour, Middle, are becoming increasingly popular amid the cost of living crisis.

title.children: 'What dreams are made of': The Queensland islands you can have all to yourself for as little as $30 a night

image.altText: an aerial view of a lithium ore crushing facility

props.synopsis: Commodity prices are being walloped. For a nation like Australia that relies upon mineral exports, the consequences could be significant.

title.children: A commodity slump has run a bulldozer over our miners, and our export income

image.altText: Back of man praying with hands up.

props.synopsis: In 2008, journalist Adriana Carranca was living in Kabul when she heard about a local pizza shop run by fellow Brazilians. The owners were on a secret mission, but not the type she expected.

title.children: This couple risked death to run a pizza shop in Afghanistan. It was a front for their secret mission

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Jake Sullivan is on trial in the ACT Supreme Court for the alleged rape of a female cadet at the Australian Defence Force Academy (ADFA) in Canberra.

title.children: Woman who alleges she was raped at ADFA tells court she felt 'alone' and 'vulnerable' in the aftermath

image.altText: A Brisbane Broncos NRLW player puts her arms wide in triumph as she and her teammates walk back after scoring the winning try.

props.synopsis: The fight for top spot will go down to the last day of the NRLW regular season, as the Brisbane Broncos snatch a thrilling win over Cronulla in the final seconds to put them on top, at least temporarily.

title.children: Last-second try gives Broncos a vital win over NRLW leaders Cronulla

image.altText: Iceland mountain at night with a very bright green aurora in the sky

props.synopsis: An awe-inspiring image of the progression of Bailey's beads during the 2023 annular solar eclipse has placed first out of 3,500 entries from 58 countries.

title.children: Solar eclipse image announced the winner of the 2024 Astronomy Photographer of the Year award

image.altText: A composite photo of Japan's Economics Minister Sanae Takaichi and Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa.

props.synopsis: Two women are in the running to lead Japan's Liberal Democratic Party and thus be virtually guaranteed to become the country's first female prime minister.

title.children: Why a woman becoming Japan's PM won't necessarily be good for gender equality

image.altText: Jeff Buckley's cover photo for the album grace, close up of his face, looking down, holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: If you've ever cringed through a talent show rendition of Hallelujah, this album — and the Australian music loving public of the 90s — probably had something to do with it.

title.children: The little-known role Australia played in Jeff Buckley's cold and broken Hallelujah

image.altText: Two Richmond AFLW players embrace as they celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: Richmond posts consecutive victories after a five-goal opening term lays the platform for a 46-point defeat of Sydney in Coffs Harbour.

title.children: Tigers romp to massive AFLW win over Swans

image.altText: A woman on a horse in the ocean

props.synopsis: Andrew McCarthy has spent more than a decade combining his two loves — horses and the ocean — while putting a sleepy Queensland beach side town firmly on the tourism map.

title.children: Tourists from 'all over the world' have ridden horses on this beach, but it's time to hang up the reins

image.altText: A woman putting on lipstick while looking in a mirror backstage of a theatre.

props.synopsis: Behind the velvet curtain of a dimly lit stage, a group of mothers is preparing to shine. By day, they're doing the school run, but by night they perform burlesque.

title.children: For these mums, burlesque provides friendship, freedom and a strict 'no-judgement zone'
